name: Museo del Oro
description: Explore the world's largest collection of pre-Hispanic gold artifacts, showcasing the rich history and craftsmanship of Colombia's indigenous cultures.

name: Cerro de Monserrate
description: Ascend this iconic mountain for breathtaking panoramic views of Bogotá and visit the historic sanctuary at its peak. A must-see for any visitor.

name: La Candelaria
description: Wander through the cobblestone streets of Bogotá's oldest neighborhood, admiring colonial architecture, vibrant street art, and numerous cultural sites.

name: Plaza de Bolívar
description: The main square of Bogotá, surrounded by significant government buildings and the Primary Cathedral. A central point for understanding Colombian history.

name: Museo Botero
description: Enjoy the unique 'Boterismo' style at this museum showcasing works donated by Fernando Botero, alongside pieces from his personal international collection.

name: Jardín Botánico José Celestino Mutis
description: Discover Colombia's incredible biodiversity in this expansive botanical garden, featuring flora from various regions like the Andes and the Amazon.

name: Teatro Colón
description: Experience world-class performances in Colombia's majestic national theatre, an architectural jewel known for its stunning interior and rich history.

name: Usaquén Flea Market
description: Explore the vibrant Sunday flea market in the charming Usaquén district, offering artisan crafts, food, and a lively atmosphere.
